4244.name: abdominal abscess
4244.description: A localized collection of pus in the abdominal cavity.

4709.name: abdominal calcification in an infant or child
4709.description: Presence of abnormal calcifications in the abdomen of a pediatric patient.

3106.name: abdominal lymphadenopathy
3106.description: Enlargement of the abdominal lymph nodes.

3049.name: abdominal wall calcification
3049.description: Deposition of calcium in the tissues of the abdominal wall.

3058.name: abdominal wall mass
3058.description: A localized soft tissue mass within the abdominal wall.

3131.name: abnormal abdominal vessels
3131.description: Vascular anomalies or abnormalities identified in the abdominal vessels.

4258.name: abnormal left upper quadrant abdominal gas collection
4258.description: Presence of unusual gas collection in the left upper abdominal quadrant.

3585.name: abnormal position of stomach
3585.description: The stomach is located outside its normal anatomic position.

4243.name: abnormal right upper quadrant abdominal gas collection
4243.description: Abnormal gas collection situated in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen.

640.name: abnormal small bowel position
640.description: The small intestine is located outside its normal anatomic location or course.

2547.name: abnormality on splenic arteriography
2547.description: Any vascular abnormality identified during imaging of the splenic artery.

57.name: achalasia
57.description: A motility disorder of the esophagus leading to impaired relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter.

22476.name: acquired esophageal stenosis
22476.description: Narrowing of the esophagus that occurs due to an acquired cause.

4747.name: acute nonobstructive small bowel distention
4747.description: Acute dilatation of small bowel loops without evidence of obstruction.

56.name: air in esophagus
56.description: Presence of gas within the esophageal lumen.

4826.name: anechoic liver lesion
4826.description: A liver lesion that appears echo-free (dark) on ultrasound, suggesting cystic nature.

5557.name: annular abdominal calcification
5557.description: Ring-like calcification found in the abdomen.

4939.name: annular lesion of colon
4939.description: A ring-like or circumferential lesion narrowing the colon lumen.

22470.name: anorectal anomaly
22470.description: Congenital abnormality involving the anus and/or rectum.

3865.name: anterior indentation on rectosigmoid junction
3865.description: A focal inward contour abnormality at the anterior aspect of the rectosigmoid junction, often detected on contrast enema.

3808.name: aphthoid ulcer of bowel
3808.description: A small, shallow mucosal ulceration often seen in inflammatory bowel disease.

5280.name: appendiceal mass
5280.description: A localized mass at the appendiceal location, which may represent phlegmon or abscess.

18758.name: arterial hyperenhancement of focal liver lesion
18758.description: Liver lesion showing marked enhancement in the arterial phase, often associated with hypervascular tumors.

480.name: ascites
480.description: Accumulation of free fluid within the peritoneal cavity.

4368.name: ascites in an infant or child
4368.description: Presence of free peritoneal fluid specifically in the pediatric population.

4970.name: asymmetric bowel wall thickening
4970.description: Unequal thickening of the bowel wall, can be due to neoplastic or inflammatory processes.

5746.name: avascular or hypovascular liver lesion
5746.description: A liver lesion lacking normal vascular enhancement, potentially indicating benign or malignant pathology.

4207.name: benign small bowel tumor
4207.description: A non-malignant neoplastic growth arising from the small intestine.

5479.name: bile duct filling defect
5479.description: Abnormal intraluminal structure or mass within the bile duct causing a filling defect.

5492.name: bile duct narrowing or obstruction
5492.description: Partial or complete blockage or stricture within the bile duct, impeding bile flow.

1732.name: biliary dilatation without jaundice or obstruction
1732.description: Enlargement of the intrahepatic or extrahepatic bile ducts without clinical evidence of jaundice or demonstrable blockage.

1741.name: biliary obstruction without dilatation
1741.description: Impaired bile flow where bile ducts remain non-dilated, can occur acutely or with certain pathologies.

22471.name: biliary system abnormality
22471.description: Generic term for any anatomic or pathologic abnormality affecting the biliary system.

18825.name: biliary tract filling defect
18825.description: Any intraluminal abnormality within the biliary tract resulting in occlusion seen as a filling defect.

1486.name: biliary-enteric fistula
1486.description: An abnormal communication between the biliary system and gastrointestinal tract.

5533.name: biliary-pleural fistula
5533.description: An abnormal communication between the biliary system and the pleural cavity.

777.name: blind loop syndrome
777.description: A condition caused by stagnant bowel loops allowing bacterial overgrowth, resulting from surgical alteration or congenital anomalies.

3578.name: bowel ischemia
3578.description: Compromised blood supply to the intestines that can result in bowel wall injury or necrosis.

5077.name: bowel wall thickening with heterogeneous enhancement
5077.description: Increase in bowel wall thickness with non-uniform contrast enhancement, indicating possible underlying inflammation or tumor.

5075.name: bowel wall thickening with homogeneous enhancement
5075.description: Uniformly increased thickness of the bowel wall showing homogeneous post-contrast enhancement.

1880.name: Budd-Chiari syndrome
1880.description: Hepatic venous outflow obstruction leading to liver congestion and potentially liver failure.

5520.name: bulls-eye lesion of gastrointestinal tract
5520.description: A target-like lesion pattern within the GI tract, often due to polypoid masses or submucosal lesions.

2129.name: bulls-eye liver lesion
2129.description: A lesion in the liver showing concentric rings, commonly seen in metastases or abscesses.

5963.name: bulls-eye liver metastasis
5963.description: Secondary liver tumor exhibiting a concentric ring or target appearance.

1552.name: calcification in gallbladder or common bile duct
1552.description: Presence of calcified material or stones within the gallbladder or bile duct.

4658.name: calcified liver metastasis
4658.description: Metastatic lesion in the liver exhibiting calcifications.

4855.name: calcified pancreatic lesion
4855.description: A lesion in the pancreas containing calcified material.

61.name: caustic esophagitis
61.description: Inflammation of the esophagus due to ingestion of caustic substances.

2372.name: cavernous transformation of portal vein
2372.description: Development of multiple collateral veins replacing a thrombosed portal vein.

2863.name: cecal distention
2863.description: Abnormal distention or enlargement of the cecum, often seen in obstruction or ileus.

1363.name: cecal lesion
1363.description: A mass or abnormal tissue detected within the cecum.

570.name: cholecystitis
570.description: Inflammation of the gallbladder, often due to gallstones.

4402.name: choledochoenteric fistula
4402.description: An abnormal communication between the common bile duct and the intestinal tract.

862.name: chronic nonobstructive small bowel distention
862.description: Persistent dilation of small bowel loops in the absence of mechanical obstruction.

3908.name: chylous ascites
3908.description: Presence of milky, lipid-rich fluid within the peritoneal cavity due to lymphatic leakage.

22460.name: cirrhosis
22460.description: Chronic liver disease characterized by fibrosis and regenerative nodules.

22473.name: colitis
22473.description: Inflammation of the colon with wall thickening and mucosal changes.

5254.name: colon wall thickening
5254.description: Abnormal thickening of the colon wall, can be due to inflammation, infection, or malignancy.

1304.name: colonic distention without obstruction
1304.description: Enlargement of the colon without evidence of a mechanical blockage.

1177.name: colonic tumor
1177.description: A mass arising from the colon, often representing a neoplastic process.

411.name: combined gastric antral and duodenal disease
411.description: Diseases involving both the gastric antrum and the duodenum.

5355.name: complex pancreatic lesion
5355.description: A heterogeneous lesion of the pancreas with both cystic and solid components.

4323.name: congenital abdominal calcifications
4323.description: Calcifications present in the abdomen from birth, often related to congenital conditions.

5522.name: congenital biliary tract abnormality
5522.description: An abnormality of the biliary system present at birth.

5286.name: congenital intestinal malrotation
5286.description: Abnormal rotation of the intestine during embryonic development.

4905.name: conical cecum
4905.description: Cecum with a conical shape, may be a congenital or acquired abnormality.

4688.name: cystic abdominal mass in a fetus or newborn
4688.description: A fluid-filled mass in the abdomen detected in a fetus or newborn.

1753.name: cystic and saccular lesions of bile ducts with dilatation of intrahepatic bile ducts
1753.description: Cystic changes in the bile ducts accompanied by intrahepatic bile duct dilatation.
synonyms: choledochal cyst with intrahepatic bile duct dilation

1746.name: cystic and saccular lesions of bile ducts with normal-sized intrahepatic bile ducts
1746.description: Cystic or saccular changes in the bile ducts without dilatation of intrahepatic bile ducts.

19081.name: cystic fetal abdominal mass
19081.description: A fluid-filled mass identified in the fetus's abdomen.

19091.name: cystic fetal mid-abdominal mass
19091.description: A fluid-filled lesion located in the mid-abdominal area of the fetus.

19088.name: cystic fetal upper abdominal mass
19088.description: A fluid-filled lesion in the upper abdomen of a fetus.

5486.name: cystic liver lesion
5486.description: A fluid-filled area or mass within the liver.

5489.name: cystic liver metastasis
5489.description: Metastatic deposit in the liver with cystic characteristics.

5069.name: cystic mesenteric lesion
5069.description: A cystic lesion located within the mesentery.

4027.name: cystic pancreatic mass
4027.description: A fluid-containing mass within the pancreas.

5561.name: dampened waveform of hepatic vein
5561.description: Abnormal, flattened Doppler waveform of the hepatic vein suggestive of altered venous flow.

4278.name: decreased abdominal gas in a newborn
4278.description: A reduced amount of gas visible in the bowel of a newborn, indicating a possible bowel abnormality.
synonyms: paucity of bowel gas in neonate

2922.name: decreased abdominal gas in an adult
2922.description: A reduced amount of gas visible in the bowel of an adult, which may be a non-specific finding.

5105.name: decreased fold pattern in duodenum and small bowel
5105.description: Reduced visibility or presence of mucosal folds in the duodenum and small intestine, may suggest mucosal disease.

4088.name: deformity of gastric antrum
4088.description: Alteration in the normal shape or contour of the gastric antrum.

1684.name: delayed scintigraphic visualization of gallbladder
1684.description: Gallbladder is not visualized on time during a hepatobiliary (HIDA) scan, often indicative of obstruction or cholecystitis.

22570.name: diabetes insipidus
22570.description: Endocrine disorder characterized by deficiency of ADH, sometimes seen with pituitary or hypothalamic abnormalities on imaging.

22567.name: diabetes mellitus
22567.description: Chronic metabolic disease associated with high blood sugar, which may have indirect imaging findings.

22456.name: diaphragmatic hernia
22456.description: Abnormal protrusion of abdominal contents through an opening in the diaphragm.

4684.name: diffuse bowel wall thickening
4684.description: Generalized thickening of the bowel wall, seen in a variety of inflammatory, infectious, or neoplastic conditions.

146.name: diffuse diverticula of esophagus
146.description: Multiple outpouchings from the esophageal wall seen throughout its length.

4740.name: diffuse gallbladder wall thickening
4740.description: Uniform thickening of the gallbladder wall, commonly associated with inflammation or edema.

5529.name: diffuse hepatic calcifications
5529.description: Widespread calcifications throughout the liver, suggestive of previous infection or vascular insult.

4235.name: diffuse peritoneal thickening
4235.description: Generalized thickening of the peritoneal lining, often due to inflammatory, infectious, or neoplastic processes.

4045.name: diffusely decreased liver intensity
4045.description: Uniform reduction in the signal or attenuation of the liver, indicating possible diffuse liver disease.

4230.name: diffusely dense spleen
4230.description: Increased attenuation or radiodensity throughout the spleen.

5226.name: dilated bile ducts
5226.description: Enlargement of the intra- and/or extrahepatic bile ducts, suggesting obstruction or cholestasis.

4609.name: dilated intrahepatic ducts
4609.description: Enlargement of the intrahepatic bile ducts within the liver.

2674.name: dilated pancreatic duct
2674.description: Abnormal enlargement of the main pancreatic duct, which may be due to obstruction or inflammation.

829.name: dilated small bowel with normal mucosal folds
829.description: Segmental or generalized dilatation of small bowel where mucosal folds appear unaltered.
synonyms: dilated small intestine with normal valvulae conniventes

820.name: dilated small bowel with thick mucosal folds
820.description: Dilatation of small bowel accompanied by thickened mucosal folds, often indicating inflammatory or infiltrative process.
synonyms: dilated small intestine with thickened valvulae conniventes

651.name: displacement of small bowel loops
651.description: Abnormal positioning of small intestine loops, often secondary to mass effect or anatomical distortion.

3556.name: distended gallbladder in a child
3556.description: Enlargement of the gallbladder seen in pediatric patients; may indicate obstruction or other pathology.

141.name: diverticulum of lower esophagus
141.description: Outpouching arising from the distal part of the esophagus.

136.name: diverticulum of mid esophagus
136.description: Outpouching located in the middle third of the esophagus.

3557.name: diverticulum of upper esophagus
3557.description: Outpouching at the proximal esophagus, often associated with Zenker's diverticulum.

5035.name: double bubble sign
5035.description: Radiographic feature showing two adjacent rounded lucencies, typical of duodenal atresia.

1292.name: double tracking of barium in the distal colon
1292.description: Appearance of two parallel lines of barium, often seen in inflammatory bowel disease or stricturing.

125.name: double-barrel esophagus
125.description: Imaging appearance of two lumens in the esophagus, often from a mucosal tear or dissection.

629.name: duodenal dilatation without obstruction
629.description: Enlargement of the duodenum in the absence of an obstructing lesion.

594.name: duodenal narrowing or obstruction
594.description: Reduction in the caliber or blockage of the duodenum, often resulting in upstream dilatation.

5086.name: duodenal wall thickening
5086.description: Thickening of the duodenal wall, can be due to inflammation, infection, or neoplasm.

5651.name: echo within gallbladder
5651.description: Ultrasound finding of echogenic material within the gallbladder, suggestive of stones, sludge, or mass.

5526.name: echoes within bile ducts
5526.description: Echogenic foci seen within the bile ducts, may represent stones, sludge, air, or parasites.

22475.name: echogenic fetal bowel
22475.description: Ultrasound finding of fetal bowel with increased echogenicity, may indicate various fetal or maternal conditions.

1550.name: emphysematous cholecystitis
1550.description: Acute inflammation of the gallbladder with gas-forming organisms leading to gas in the wall and lumen.

5698.name: enlarged gallbladder
5698.description: Increase in size of the gallbladder, suggestive of obstruction or other pathology.

3859.name: enlarged ileocecal valve
3859.description: Imaging finding of thickening or prominence of the ileocecal valve region.

1816.name: enlarged papilla of vater
1816.description: Increase in size of the duodenal papilla, may be due to neoplasm, inflammation, or matter.

350.name: erosive gastritis
350.description: Inflammation of the gastric mucosa with erosions visualized as irregular areas on imaging.

22477.name: esophageal atresia
22477.description: Congenital absence or closure of a portion of the esophageal lumen, causing obstruction.

22478.name: esophageal dysfunction
22478.description: Abnormal function of the esophagus, manifesting as impaired movement or passage of material.

3464.name: esophageal dysmotility
3464.description: Impaired coordinated contractions of the esophagus resulting in abnormal transit.

255.name: esophageal lesion in a child
255.description: Any abnormal area or mass within the esophagus of pediatric patients.

243.name: esophageal plaques
243.description: Plaque-like thickenings on the esophageal mucosa, typically related to infection or inflammation.

22479.name: esophageal rupture
22479.description: A full thickness tear of the esophageal wall, can lead to mediastinitis.

3575.name: esophageal ulceration
3575.description: Erosions or ulcers on the esophageal wall, commonly due to reflux or infection.

249.name: esophageal varices
249.description: Dilated submucosal veins within the esophagus, usually secondary to portal hypertension.

195.name: esophageal wall thickening
195.description: Increased thickness of the esophageal wall; may reflect inflammation, neoplasm, or other causes.

4992.name: esophagobronchial fistula
4992.description: An abnormal connection between the esophagus and bronchial tree.

5205.name: extrinsic deformity of gallbladder
5205.description: Gallbladder shape altered by external pressure or mass effect.

3471.name: extrinsic impression on the cervical esophagus
3471.description: External pressure leading to indentation on the upper (cervical) part of the esophagus.

3470.name: extrinsic impression on thoracic esophagus
3470.description: External pressure or mass effect causing indentation of the thoracic esophagus.

4049.name: extrinsic indentation on duodenum
4049.description: External compression leading to indentation or narrowing of the duodenal lumen.

4982.name: extrinsic vascular impression on esophagus
4982.description: Indentation of the esophagus by adjacent vascular structures.

4354.name: fatty infiltration of pancreas
4354.description: Deposition of fat within the pancreatic parenchyma.

22461.name: fatty liver
22461.description: Abnormal accumulation of fat in liver cells.

4346.name: fatty mass in abdomen
4346.description: Any abnormal mass-like collection of fat tissue within the abdomen.

22465.name: fatty pancreas
22465.description: Presence of excess fat in the pancreatic tissue.

2640.name: fatty pancreatic lesion
2640.description: A well-defined area of fat density within the pancreas.

19115.name: fetal anterior abdominal wall defect
19115.description: Congenital defect where fetal abdominal organs herniate through the anterior abdominal wall.

19106.name: fetal ascites
19106.description: Abnormal accumulation of fluid within the peritoneal cavity of the fetus.

19077.name: fetal hepatosplenomegaly
19077.description: Enlargement of both the fetal liver and spleen.

1916.name: fetal or neonatal liver calcification
1916.description: Presence of calcified foci within the liver of a fetus or neonate.

5027.name: filling defect in gastric remnant
5027.description: Area within the gastric remnant that does not fill with contrast or is seen as a mass-like or absent area.

5001.name: filling defect in stomach
5001.description: Area in the gastric lumen that does not fill with contrast, suggestive of mass, polyp or other lesion.

5504.name: fixed gallbladder filling defect
5504.description: Non-mobile area in the gallbladder not filled with bile, suspicious for mass or adherent stone.

2274.name: focal acoustic shadowing in liver
2274.description: Well-circumscribed area in the liver causing sound attenuation and shadow on ultrasound, often from calcification or air.

4683.name: focal bowel wall thickening
4683.description: Localized segment of thickened bowel wall, may suggest inflammation, neoplasm, or other pathology.

5313.name: focal cystic or low density splenic lesion
5313.description: Well-defined area in the spleen that is cystic or of lower attenuation relative to normal splenic tissue.

3899.name: focal gallbladder wall thickening
3899.description: Localized thickening of the gallbladder wall, which may be due to inflammation, tumor, or other condition.

2297.name: focal high-attenuation liver lesion
2297.description: Localized area within the liver showing increased attenuation on CT, suggestive of hemorrhage, calcification, or hypervascular lesion.

4291.name: focal hyperechoic splenic lesion
4291.description: Bright echogenic focus in the spleen detected on ultrasound, may correspond to hemangioma, granuloma, or calcification.

5551.name: focal hypodense liver lesion
5551.description: A well-defined area of decreased attenuation in the liver relative to surrounding tissue, may represent cyst, metastasis, or abscess.

4878.name: focal shadowing pancreatic lesion
4878.description: Localized pancreatic lesion that produces posterior acoustic shadowing on ultrasound.

771.name: fold thickening of stomach and small bowel
771.description: Thickening of the mucosal folds of the stomach and small intestine, which may be seen in infection, inflammation, or infiltrative diseases.

5699.name: gallbladder empyema
5699.description: Collection of pus within the gallbladder, a severe complication of cholecystitis.

5700.name: gallbladder hydrops
5700.description: Abnormal distention of the gallbladder due to prolonged obstruction, usually without infection.

22482.name: gallstone
22482.description: Discrete stone(s) within the gallbladder or biliary tree due to precipitation of bile substances.

1091.name: gallstone ileus
1091.description: Mechanical bowel obstruction caused by a gallstone that has migrated into the intestinal lumen through a fistula.

5652.name: gallstone or gallbladder sludge in a fetus or neonate
5652.description: Echogenic foci representing stones or thickened bile seen within the fetal or neonatal gallbladder.

4403.name: gallstone perforation
4403.description: Perforation of the gallbladder wall due to a gallstone, causing leakage of bile and possibly infection.

5685.name: gas in gallbladder or biliary tract
5685.description: Presence of gas within the gallbladder or biliary tree, suggestive of infection or fistula.

2691.name: gas in pancreatic duct
2691.description: Presence of gas within the pancreatic duct, often due to fistula or infection.

5101.name: gastric fold thickening
5101.description: Thickening of gastric mucosal folds, may be due to gastritis, hypertrophy, or infiltration.

418.name: gastric outlet obstruction
418.description: Obstruction at the gastric outflow, leading to retention of stomach contents.

334.name: gastric ulceration
334.description: Break or defect in the gastric mucosa, typically related to peptic ulcer disease.

467.name: gastrocolic or gastroduodenocolic fistula
467.description: Abnormal communication between the stomach or duodenum and colon.

22481.name: gastrointestinal dysfunction
22481.description: General term for abnormal function of the gastrointestinal tract.

22483.name: gastrointestinal system bleeding
22483.description: Hemorrhage within any part of the gastrointestinal tract.

5481.name: gastrointestinal tract fistula
5481.description: Abnormal connection between segments of the GI tract or other organs.

5518.name: gastrointestinal tract thumbprinting
5518.description: Appearance of the mucosal folds resembling thumbprints, indicative of submucosal edema or hemorrhage.

22495.name: gastrointestinal tract ulcer
22495.description: Ulcer anywhere in the gastrointestinal tract.

19116.name: gastroschisis
19116.description: Congenital defect with herniation of abdominal contents through the abdominal wall, usually to the right of the umbilicus.

4637.name: generalized irregular small bowel folds
4637.description: Widespread irregularity and thickening of small bowel mucosal folds.

5536.name: hemorrhagic liver lesion
5536.description: A liver lesion containing areas of hemorrhage.

4820.name: hemorrhagic liver metastasis
4820.description: Metastatic liver lesion with hemorrhagic component.

4853.name: hepatic adenoma
4853.description: Benign liver tumor most commonly seen in young women, can be hemorrhagic.

22452.name: hepatic calcification
22452.description: Calcified foci within the liver, may be sequelae of infection, neoplasm, or prior hemorrhage.

22462.name: hepatic fibrosis
22462.description: Excess deposition of fibrous tissue in the liver, usually secondary to chronic liver disease.

2330.name: hepatic vein dilatation
2330.description: Enlargement of the hepatic veins, may be due to heart failure or hepatic venous outflow obstruction.

1845.name: hepatomegaly
1845.description: Enlargement of the liver beyond normal dimensions.

22458.name: hepatosplenomegaly in a neonate
22458.description: Simultaneous enlargement of the liver and spleen in a newborn.

5829.name: high T1 signal intensity liver lesion
5829.description: A liver lesion appearing bright on T1-weighted MRI images.

3894.name: high-attenuation bile
3894.description: Bile within the gallbladder or biliary tree that shows higher than normal attenuation on CT.

5239.name: hyperdense liver
5239.description: Increased density of the liver on non-contrast CT imaging.

5683.name: hyperechoic focus in gallbladder wall
5683.description: Bright, echogenic area in the gallbladder wall seen on ultrasound.

5484.name: hyperechoic liver
5484.description: Liver with greater than normal echogenicity on ultrasound, can be a sign of fatty infiltration.

5493.name: hyperechoic liver lesion
5493.description: A liver lesion that appears brighter than the surrounding parenchyma on ultrasound.

2190.name: hyperechoic liver metastasis with acoustic shadowing
2190.description: Metastatic liver lesion that is echogenic and casts an acoustic shadow on ultrasound.

5755.name: hypervascular liver lesion
5755.description: A liver lesion with increased blood supply evident on contrast-enhanced imaging.

4819.name: hypervascular liver metastasis
4819.description: A metastatic lesion in the liver that shows increased vascularity on imaging.

4232.name: hypervascular pancreatic lesion
4232.description: A pancreatic lesion that demonstrates increased blood flow, often seen on arterial phase imaging.

4705.name: hypoechoic liver
4705.description: Liver with lower than normal echogenicity on ultrasound.

4838.name: hypoechoic liver lesion
4838.description: A lesion in the liver that appears darker than the surrounding tissue on ultrasound.

4823.name: hypoechoic liver metastasis
4823.description: Metastatic liver lesion with lower echogenicity than surrounding liver on ultrasound.

5788.name: hypoenhancing liver lesion
5788.description: A liver lesion showing reduced contrast enhancement compared to background liver.

5791.name: hypoenhancing liver metastasis
5791.description: Metastatic liver lesion that enhances less than normal liver tissue after contrast administration.

4741.name: increased attenuation of gallbladder lumen
4741.description: Gallbladder contents appearing denser than expected on CT imaging.

4345.name: increased echogenicity of pancreas
4345.description: Pancreatic tissue appears brighter than normal on ultrasound.

5850.name: increased periportal signal intensity on MR
5850.description: Increased signal intensity of the tissue around the portal vein seen on MR imaging.

2376.name: increased portal vein flow
2376.description: Elevated blood flow through the portal vein, often assessed with Doppler ultrasound.

3889.name: increased presacral space
3889.description: Widening of the expected space anterior to the sacrum, suggestive of mass or fluid.

479.name: increased retrogastric or retroduodenal space
479.description: Widening of the space posterior to the stomach or duodenum, potentially indicating mass or fluid.

5941.name: infiltrative liver metastasis
5941.description: Liver metastatic disease that is diffusely infiltrative rather than forming discrete masses.

5289.name: innumerable tiny nodules in small bowel or colon
5289.description: Countless small nodular lesions scattered throughout the small or large bowel.

4064.name: interstitial emphysema of stomach
4064.description: Gas within the wall of the stomach, indicating emphysematous gastritis or other wall injury.

22544.name: intestinal lymphangiectasia
22544.description: Dilatation of the intestinal lymphatic vessels, often resulting in protein-losing enteropathy.

22487.name: intestinal malrotation
22487.description: Congenital abnormal rotation of the midgut resulting in abnormal bowel placement.

22484.name: intestinal obstruction
22484.description: Blockage of the intestinal lumen preventing the normal passage of contents.

1065.name: intestinal obstruction in a child
1065.description: Blockage of intestine in a pediatric patient, often due to congenital or acquired causes.

1047.name: intestinal obstruction in a newborn
1047.description: Obstruction of the intestine in a neonate, commonly due to congenital anomalies.

1080.name: intestinal obstruction in an adult
1080.description: Blockage of intestine occurring in an adult patient, due to various causes.

4908.name: intestinal pseudo-obstruction
4908.description: Clinical and radiological features of obstruction without mechanical blockage, usually due to dysmotility.

1463.name: intramural gastrointestinal tract hemorrhage
1463.description: Bleeding into the wall of the gastrointestinal tract.

4236.name: isoechoic liver lesion
4236.description: Liver lesion that has the same echogenicity as the surrounding parenchyma on ultrasound.

2860.name: large abdominal gas pocket
2860.description: A substantial collection of intraperitoneal gas, which may indicate perforation.

19098.name: large fetal abdomen during third trimester
19098.description: Abnormally increased abdominal circumference in a fetus during the third trimester.

5202.name: layering abdominal calcifications
5202.description: Calcifications in the abdomen that demonstrate layering, suggesting cystic or sedimented material.

5028.name: lesion of gastric fundus
5028.description: Any abnormal lesion located in the upper part of the stomach.

2269.name: linear or branching acoustic shadowing in liver
2269.description: Linear or branching areas of shadowing in the liver, seen on ultrasound, typically due to air or calcification.

4074.name: linitis plastica pattern of stomach
4074.description: A diffuse thickening and rigidity of the gastric wall, usually due to infiltrative malignancy.

5876.name: liver lesion and elevated alpha fetoprotein
5876.description: A liver mass in a patient with elevated AFP, often suggesting hepatocellular carcinoma.

5258.name: liver lesion with calcification
5258.description: A hepatic mass containing areas of calcification.

4668.name: liver lesion with central scar
4668.description: A liver mass characterized by a central fibrous scar, typical of focal nodular hyperplasia.

5567.name: liver lesion with contrast fill-in
5567.description: A hepatic lesion that gradually fills in with contrast, characteristic of hemangioma.

5562.name: liver lesion with fluid-fluid level
5562.description: A hepatic lesion exhibiting fluid-fluid levels, often seen in hemorrhagic or cystic lesions.

4814.name: liver lesion with T2 hypointense rim
4814.description: A hepatic lesion with a dark rim on T2-weighted MRI, suggesting a capsule or fibrous tissue.
synonyms: T2 dark rim in liver lesion

5820.name: liver lesions with no circumferential rim on MR
5820.description: Hepatic lesions that do not show a complete rim on MR imaging, affecting differential diagnosis.

4817.name: liver lesions with T1 hypointense rim
4817.description: Liver masses showing a dark rim on T1-weighted MRI images.
synonyms: T1 dark rim in liver lesion

5707.name: lobar or segmental liver perfusion abnormality
5707.description: Abnormal enhancement pattern involving a specific liver lobe or segment, indicating perfusion change.

3934.name: localized narrowing of esophagus
3934.description: A focal area of esophageal stricture, which may be due to malignancy, inflammation, or other cause.

5720.name: low-attenuation liver
5720.description: Diffuse decrease in liver density, commonly due to hepatic steatosis (fatty liver).

5517.name: lower abdominal mass in a neonate or child
5517.description: A space-occupying lesion in the lower abdomen of a pediatric patient.

22486.name: malabsorption
22486.description: Clinical syndrome of impaired nutrient absorption in the gastrointestinal tract.

5521.name: malabsorption pattern in small bowel
5521.description: Imaging pattern suggestive of impaired absorption in the small intestine, such as fold thickening or dilation.

4206.name: malignant small bowel tumor
4206.description: A cancerous mass arising from the small intestine.

4312.name: marked bowel wall thickening
4312.description: Significant increase in thickness of the bowel wall, seen in infection, inflammation, or malignancy.

18806.name: mass in the porta hepatis
18806.description: A lesion or mass located at the porta hepatis, which can cause biliary obstruction.

22488.name: meconium plug
22488.description: Obstruction of the colon in a neonate due to thick meconium.

5278.name: meconium plug in newborn
5278.description: Obstructing meconium in the colon of a newborn infant.

1325.name: megacolon
1325.description: Abnormal dilation of the colon due to various causes.

22490.name: microcolon
22490.description: Abnormally small caliber colon, often due to unused or atretic bowel.

5275.name: microcolon in newborn
5275.description: Microcolon identified in a neonate, often related to distal bowel obstruction or atresia.

22491.name: microgastria
22491.description: Congenital abnormality where the stomach is abnormally small.

4311.name: mild bowel wall thickening
4311.description: Subtle increase in the thickness of the bowel wall.

1547.name: milk of calcium bile
1547.description: Suspension of calcium salts within the bile, causing layering densities.

4735.name: misty mesentery
4735.description: Increased attenuation and haziness of mesenteric fat, often due to inflammation or infiltration.

4824.name: mixed echogenicity liver metastasis
4824.description: Liver metastases showing both hypoechoic and hyperechoic areas, indicating heterogeneous composition.

5743.name: mucin-secreting liver metastasis
5743.description: Liver metastases characterized by mucin production, often from GI tract primaries.

3237.name: mucocele of gallbladder
3237.description: Distended gallbladder due to accumulated mucus, typically from cystic duct obstruction.

3607.name: mucosal destruction of small bowel
3607.description: Loss or disruption of the mucosal lining of the small intestine.

5081.name: multiple duodenal filling defects
5081.description: Presence of multiple radiolucencies or masses in the duodenum on contrast study.

4948.name: multiple filling defects in colon
4948.description: More than one area of contrast exclusion in colon, suggestive of polyps or masses.

4633.name: multiple hepatic cysts
4633.description: Presence of multiple cystic lesions in the liver, often benign.

4022.name: multiple hypointense liver lesions
4022.description: Multiple liver lesions appearing darker than surrounding tissue, may represent metastases or benign lesions.

5722.name: multiple solid liver lesions
5722.description: More than one solid (non-cystic) lesion in the liver, often neoplastic.

4220.name: multiple splenic calcifications
4220.description: Several areas of calcification within splenic tissue.

5315.name: multiple splenic hyperintensities
5315.description: Numerous splenic lesions with high signal intensity, seen on MR imaging.

5290.name: multiple splenic hypointensities
5290.description: Multiple areas in the spleen appearing darker than adjacent tissue, seen on MRI.

4183.name: non-obstructive gastric dilatation
4183.description: Enlargement of the stomach not due to a mechanical obstruction.

5649.name: nonshadowing lesion in the gallbladder
5649.description: A gallbladder lesion that doesn't produce acoustic shadowing on ultrasound.

2979.name: nonvisceral abdominal calcification
2979.description: Calcification present in the abdomen but not within visceral organs.

19067.name: nonvisualization of fetal stomach
19067.description: The fetal stomach is not seen on prenatal ultrasound.

5642.name: nonvisualization of gallbladder
5642.description: Gallbladder is not visualized on imaging.

3281.name: omphalocele
3281.description: Congenital abdominal wall defect with herniation of abdominal contents within a membrane.

22453.name: pancreatic calcification
22453.description: Presence of calcifications within the pancreas.

2614.name: pancreatic calcification without mass
2614.description: Pancreatic calcifications observed in the absence of a discrete mass.

5410.name: pancreatic duct stricture or filling defect with abnormal parenchyma
5410.description: Stricture or filling defect of the pancreatic duct accompanied by abnormal pancreatic tissue.
synonyms: pancreatic duct abnormality with parenchymal changes

5409.name: pancreatic duct stricture or filling defect with normal parenchyma
5409.description: Stricture or filling defect of the pancreatic duct with otherwise normal pancreatic tissue.

22464.name: pancreatic dysplasia
22464.description: Abnormal development or organization of the pancreatic tissue.

22492.name: pancreatic exocrine insufficiency
22492.description: Decreased secretion of digestive enzymes by the pancreas, can be suggested by atrophic pancreas or indirect findings.

5368.name: pancreatic lesion characterized by blood
5368.description: A pancreatic lesion with imaging features of hemorrhage.

22467.name: pancreatitis in a child
22467.description: Inflammation of the pancreas occurring in pediatric patients.

4851.name: patchy liver
4851.description: Liver demonstrates areas of heterogeneous echotexture or density.

2004.name: peliosis hepatis
2004.description: Rare condition of blood-filled cystic spaces in the liver.

4718.name: perforated hollow viscus in an infant
4718.description: Evidence of bowel or gastrointestinal tract perforation in an infant, often seen as pneumoperitoneum.

3554.name: pericholecystic fluid
3554.description: Fluid accumulation around the gallbladder, often suggesting inflammation or infection.

1284.name: pericolic abscess
1284.description: Localized collection of pus adjacent to the colon.

1731.name: periportal edema
1731.description: Edema or low attenuation/fluid seen around the portal triads in the liver.

5233.name: periportal lymphadenopathy
5233.description: Enlargement of lymph nodes along the portal triad region.

2728.name: peritoneal disease
2728.description: Abnormal process affecting the peritoneum, may be infectious, inflammatory, or neoplastic.

2850.name: pneumatosis intestinalis
2850.description: Presence of gas within the wall of the intestines.

2826.name: pneumoperitoneum with peritonitis
2826.description: Free air within the peritoneal cavity associated with inflammation of the peritoneum.

19136.name: polyhydramnios
19136.description: Increased volume of amniotic fluid, usually seen in prenatal imaging.

1556.name: porcelain gallbladder
1556.description: Calcification of the gallbladder wall, giving a radiopaque appearance.

1651.name: portal hypertension
1651.description: Increased pressure within the portal venous system, often due to liver disease.

2852.name: portal vein gas
2852.description: Gas within the portal venous system, often a sign of bowel ischemia or infection.

35535.name: portal vein obstruction
35535.description: Blockage of the portal vein by thrombus, mass, or other cause.

35534.name: portal vein thrombosis
35534.description: Formation of a blood clot in the portal vein.

22555.name: portal venous hypertension
22555.description: Elevation of blood pressure within the portal venous system; synonymous with portal hypertension.

583.name: postbulbar duodenal ulceration
583.description: Ulceration located in the duodenum distal to the duodenal bulb.

2415.name: prominent periportal echoes in a neonate
2415.description: Increased echogenicity of tissue around the portal triads in neonatal liver ultrasound.

3868.name: rectal disease
3868.description: Pathology affecting the rectum; includes inflammatory, infectious, or neoplastic conditions.

4439.name: regenerating liver nodule
4439.description: Benign nodular lesion in the liver due to regeneration, usually in cirrhosis.

4006.name: regular thickening of small bowel folds
4006.description: Uniform thickening of small bowel mucosal folds, often due to edema or infiltration.

4772.name: residual intestinal barium
4772.description: Persistence of barium contrast in the intestines after an imaging study.

1.name: retained material in hypopharynx
1.description: Presence of food, barium, or other material in the hypopharynx, potentially indicating aspiration risk.

1551.name: ruptured gallbladder
1551.description: Disruption of the gallbladder wall, usually due to inflammation, trauma, or perforation.

3642.name: segmental bowel wall thickening
3642.description: Thickening of a discrete segment of the bowel wall, may indicate inflammation, infection, or neoplasm.

3648.name: segmental narrowing of colon
3648.description: A localized region of the colon exhibiting reduced luminal diameter.

3579.name: sentinel loop
3579.description: A localized dilated loop of bowel, commonly due to nearby inflammation.

5910.name: septated gallbladder
5910.description: Presence of linear septations or divisions within the gallbladder.

705.name: small bowel diverticulum
705.description: Outpouching of the small bowel wall, may be congenital or acquired.

712.name: small bowel pseudodiverticulum
712.description: Outpouching of the mucosa and submucosa through the muscularis of the small bowel.

3602.name: small bowel wall thickening
3602.description: Abnormally increased thickness of the small bowel wall.

5285.name: small gallbladder
5285.description: Gallbladder of smaller than normal size, may be contracted or congenitally small.

2484.name: small or nonvisualized spleen
2484.description: Spleen that appears smaller than expected or is not visible.

1294.name: smooth colon
1294.description: Colon with a uniformly featureless mucosa which may result from disease processes.

5511.name: solid liver lesion in adult
5511.description: Discrete solid mass lesion identified within the liver of an adult.

5509.name: solid liver lesion in an infant or young child
5509.description: Solid mass within the liver of an infant or young child, may be benign or malignant.

5512.name: solid liver lesion in an older child or adolescent
5512.description: Solid lesion within the liver identified in an older child or adolescent.

5064.name: solid mesenteric lesion
5064.description: A discrete, solid mass within the mesentery.

4026.name: solid pancreatic mass
4026.description: A focal, solid lesion arising in the pancreas, may be benign or malignant.

149.name: solitary esophageal filling defect
149.description: A single intraluminal defect in the esophagus on contrast studies.

1154.name: solitary filling defect in colon
1154.description: A single area of non-opacification within the colon indicating space-occupying lesion.

522.name: solitary intrinsic duodenal mass
522.description: A discrete mass lesion within the wall of the duodenum.

2512.name: solitary lesion of spleen
2512.description: A single abnormal mass or focal lesion identified in the spleen.

5163.name: solitary small bowel mass with preserved mucosa
5163.description: A single small bowel lesion where overlying mucosa appears intact.

4219.name: solitary splenic calcification
4219.description: A discrete, calcified focus seen within the spleen.

5197.name: sonographic bulls-eye sign
5197.description: A concentric lesion appearance on ultrasound, often associated with metastasis or abscess.

2252.name: sonographically complex hepatic mass
2252.description: A liver mass on ultrasound showing both cystic and solid components or internal heterogeneity.

22455.name: splenic calcification
22455.description: Calcium deposits within the spleen, usually sequelae of infection, trauma, or prior infarct.

4041.name: splenic infarction
4041.description: Death of splenic tissue due to interruption of blood supply.

4227.name: splenic vein obstruction
4227.description: Blockage of blood flow in the splenic vein, leading to venous congestion.

3565.name: splenomegaly
3565.description: Enlargement of the spleen beyond normal limits.

4733.name: splenomegaly with diffuse hyperechoic pattern
4733.description: Enlarged spleen on ultrasound with diffusely increased echogenicity.

4731.name: splenomegaly with diffuse hypoechoic pattern
4731.description: Enlarged spleen on ultrasound with diffusely decreased echogenicity.

4726.name: splenomegaly with normal echogenicity
4726.description: Enlarged spleen with echogenicity similar to normal spleen tissue.

2000.name: spontaneous liver rupture
2000.description: Nontraumatic disruption of hepatic parenchyma, often with hemoperitoneum.

2817.name: spontaneous pneumoperitoneum without peritonitis
2817.description: Gas in the peritoneal cavity without evidence of acute inflammation or peritonitis.

4833.name: starry-sky liver
4833.description: Liver with prominent portal triads giving a speckled, starry-sky ultrasound appearance, usually in hepatitis.

22494.name: steatorrhea
22494.description: Fatty stool due to malabsorption; radiographically, may see greasy bowel content or indirect signs.

4739.name: striations in thickened gallbladder wall
4739.description: Linear echogenic and hypoechoic bands within a thickened gallbladder wall, often associated with edema.

5708.name: subsegmental liver perfusion abnormality
5708.description: Discreet regions of the liver with abnormal perfusion compared to normal parenchyma.

599.name: superior mesenteric artery syndrome
599.description: Compression of the third portion of the duodenum between the aorta and SMA, causing obstruction.

4969.name: symmetric bowel wall thickening
4969.description: Uniform thickening of the bowel wall, seen in diffuse inflammatory or ischemic conditions.

18841.name: T1-hyperintense intraluminal gallbladder lesion
18841.description: A lesion within the gallbladder lumen that appears bright on T1-weighted MRI.

18740.name: T1-hyperintense liver lesion
18740.description: A liver lesion with increased signal intensity on T1-weighted MRI images.

18837.name: T2-hyperintense intraluminal gallbladder lesion
18837.description: A lesion within the gallbladder lumen that appears bright on T2-weighted MRI.

18720.name: T2-hyperintense liver lesion
18720.description: A liver lesion that appears brighter than surrounding tissue on T2-weighted MRI images.

18794.name: T2-hyperintense periportal tissue
18794.description: Increased T2 signal in the tissue surrounding the portal tracts on MRI.

18832.name: T2-hypointense intraluminal gallbladder lesion
18832.description: A lesion within the gallbladder lumen that appears darker than the surrounding bile on T2-weighted MRI sequences.

18748.name: T2-hypointense liver lesion
18748.description: A liver lesion appearing darker than the surrounding parenchyma on T2-weighted images.

879.name: terminal ileum lesion
879.description: Abnormality or mass involving the terminal section of the ileum.

4239.name: thickening of bile duct walls
4239.description: Increased thickness of the walls of the bile ducts, suggestive of inflammation or other pathology.

974.name: toxic megacolon
974.description: Acute and severe colonic dilatation with systemic toxicity, usually related to colitis.

3965.name: transverse mucosal folds in the esophagus
3965.description: Presence of mucosal folds that run transversely in the esophagus, seen with various esophageal conditions.

4842.name: upper abdominal mass in a neonate or child
4842.description: Abnormal growth or mass detected in the upper abdomen of a pediatric patient.

4242.name: widening of duodenal C-loop
4242.description: Increased distance or dilatation of the duodenal sweep, often associated with mass effect or obstruction.

3038.name: widespread abdominal calcifications
3038.description: Multiple areas of calcification distributed throughout the abdomen.

225.name: widespread irregular esophageal mucosa
225.description: Irregular appearance of the entire esophageal lining, potentially related to inflammation or neoplasia.
